001package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup;
002
003import org.immutables.value.Value;
004
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
008
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonDemographic;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiablePerson;
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
012import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
013import io.github.ai4ci.functions.EmpiricalDistribution;
014import io.github.ai4ci.functions.EmpiricalFunction;
015import io.github.ai4ci.functions.ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution;
016import io.github.ai4ci.functions.ImmutableEmpiricalFunction;
017import io.github.ai4ci.functions.LinkFunction;
018import io.github.ai4ci.functions.SimpleFunction;
019import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
020import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
021
022/**
023 * Age stratified demographic configuration and helpers.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * This interface describes a simple age stratified demography used during setup
027 * and baselining. It supplies an empirical age distribution and a function
028 * expressing the odds of contact as a function of age difference.
029 * Implementations are used when creating person stubs and when computing
030 * relationship strengths between agents.
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * Downstream uses include setup and builder code such as
034 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder#setupOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak, io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler)}
035 * and per‑person baselining in
036 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultPersonBaseliner#baselinePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler)}.
037 * The {@link #createPersonStub(Outbreak)} helper samples ages for new
038 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person} instances during setup.
039 *
040 * @author Rob Challen
041 */
042@Value.Immutable
043@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableAgeStratifiedDemography.class)
044@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableAgeStratifiedDemography.class)
045public interface AgeStratifiedDemography extends LocationAwareDemography {
046
047        /**
048         * Sensible default age stratified demography used in examples and tests.
049         *
050         * <p>
051         * The default supplies a simple age distribution and an odds function that
052         * describes relative contact likelihood by age difference. Tests and
053         * examples may rely on this instance as a compact baseline.
054         */
055        public static ImmutableAgeStratifiedDemography DEFAULT = ImmutableAgeStratifiedDemography
056                        .builder()
057                        .setAgeDistribution(
058                                        ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution.builder().setMinimum(0)
059                                                        .setMaximum(120).setX(18, 45, 65, 85)
060                                                        .setCumulativeProbability(0.1, 0.5, 0.75, 0.9).build()
061                        )
062                        .setOddsContactFromAgeDifference(
063                                        ImmutableEmpiricalFunction.builder().setX(0, 10, 25, 40, 60, 70)
064                                                        .setY(2, 0.5, 1.5, 0.5, 1, 0.5).setLink(LinkFunction.LOG)
065                                                        .build()
066                        ).setContactProximityBias(2.0).build();
067
068        /**
069         * Adjust a base contact probability by the age difference between two
070         * people.
071         *
072         * <p>
073         * This helper converts the supplied base probability {@code p} into an
074         * adjusted probability using the normalised age‑difference odds ratio. The
075         * odds ratio is applied using {@link Conversions#scaleProbabilityByOR} to
076         * preserve valid probability semantics.
077         *
078         * @param p   base contact probability
079         * @param one source person
080         * @param two target person
081         * @return a probability adjusted for age-based contact odds
082         */
083        default double adjustedProbabilityContact(double p, Person one, Person two) {
084                double age1 = one.getDemographic().getAge();
085                double age2 = two.getDemographic().getAge();
086                double diff = Math.abs(age1 - age2);
087                return Conversions.scaleProbabilityByOR(
088                                p, this.getNormalisedOddsContactFromAgeDifference().value(diff)
089                );
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Create a modifiable person stub and populate the person's age from the
094         * configured age distribution.
095         *
096         * <p>
097         * This helper is a convenience used during outbreak setup when the builder
098         * needs to create a population quickly. Downstream callers include the setup
099         * stage in {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder}. The
100         * returned {@link ModifiablePerson} has an
101         * {@link ImmutablePersonDemographic} with an age sampled from
102         * {@link #getAgeDistribution()}.
103         *
104         * @param outbreak the owning outbreak used to attach the created person
105         * @return a modifiable person with a sampled age demographic
106         */
107        @Override
108        default ModifiablePerson createPersonStub(Outbreak outbreak) {
109                ModifiablePerson tmp = Person.createPersonStub(outbreak);
110                tmp.setDemographic(
111                                ImmutablePersonDemographic.builder().from(tmp.getDemographic())
112                                                .setAge(this.getAgeDistribution().sample()).build()
113                );
114                return tmp;
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * The demographics of the population.
119         *
120         * @return an empirical cumulative distribution describing population ages
121         */
122        EmpiricalDistribution getAgeDistribution();
123
124        /**
125         * Normalised odds function for age difference.
126         *
127         * <p>
128         * When {@link #getOddsContactFromAgeDifference()} is an
129         * {@link EmpiricalFunction} this method returns a function that has been
130         * normalised against the joint age distribution. The normalisation produces
131         * a baseline odds function suitable for combining with other contact
132         * modifiers.
133         *
134         * @return a normalised odds function for age difference
135         */
136        @JsonIgnore @Value.Default
137        default SimpleFunction getNormalisedOddsContactFromAgeDifference() {
138                if (this.getOddsContactFromAgeDifference() instanceof EmpiricalFunction)
139                        return this.getAgeDistribution()
140                                        .combine(
141                                                        this.getAgeDistribution(), (d1, d2) -> Math.abs(d1 - d2)
142                                        ).getInterpolation()
143                                        .baselineOdds(
144                                                        ((EmpiricalFunction) this
145                                                                        .getOddsContactFromAgeDifference())
146                                        );
147                return this.getOddsContactFromAgeDifference();
148        }
149
150        /**
151         * Odds ratio function for making a contact given absolute age difference.
152         *
153         * <p>
154         * The function returns a non‑negative odds ratio for a given absolute age
155         * difference; callers typically normalize or combine this function with
156         * other contact modifiers. If the implementation is an
157         * {@link EmpiricalFunction} it will be normalised by
158         * {@link #getNormalisedOddsContactFromAgeDifference()}.
159         *
160         * @return a function mapping age difference to odds ratio
161         */
162        SimpleFunction getOddsContactFromAgeDifference();
163
164        /**
165         * Compute relationship strength between two people, incorporating age
166         * effects.
167         *
168         * <p>
169         * The default implementation delegates to
170         * {@link LocationAwareDemography#getRelationshipStrength(Person,Person,Sampler)}
171         * then scales the result by the age‑difference adjusted probability via
172         * {@link #adjustedProbabilityContact(double, Person, Person)}. This is the
173         * canonical place to combine location and demographic contact modifiers.
174         *
175         * @param source  the source person
176         * @param target  the target person
177         * @param sampler a sampler used for any stochastic elements in the base
178         *                relationship strength
179         * @return a relationship strength used as an odds/probability modifier
180         */
181        @Override
182        default public double getRelationshipStrength(
183                        Person source, Person target, Sampler sampler
184        ) {
185                return this.adjustedProbabilityContact(
186                                LocationAwareDemography.super.getRelationshipStrength(
187                                                source, target, sampler
188                                ), source, target
189                );
190        }
191
192}
